str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To purpose, design beforehand, determine. Middle voice from pro and tithemi; to place before, i.e. to exhibit; to propose.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
Neuter of a derivative of hilaskomai; an expiatory, i.e. an atoning victim, or the lid of the Ark.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A showing, proof, demonstration, sign, token. From endeiknumi; indication.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Forbearance, suspense or delay (of punishment), patience. From anechomai; self-restraint, i.e. Tolerance.
Overlooking, suspension, remission of punishment for. From ktetor; praetermission, i.e. Toleration.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fault, sin, evil deed. From hamartano; a sin.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: To happen (come about) previously. From pro and ginomai; to be already, i.e. Have previousy transpired.
